gurmukhi: ਕਾਰਤਕ ਜੈਸੇ ਦੀਪਮਾਲਕਾ ਰਜਨੀ ਸਮੈ ਦੀਪ ਜੋਤਿ ਕੋ ੳੁਦੋਤ ਹੋਤ ਹੀ ਬਿਲਾਤ ਹੈ
transliteration: Kaaratak Jaisay Deepamaalakaa Rajanee Samai , Deep Joti Ko Udot Hot Hee Bilaat Hai ?
translation: Just as on festival of Diwali, that falls in the Indian month of Kartik, many earthen lamps are lit at night, and their light go off after a short period;

gurmukhi: ਬਰਖਾ ਸਮੈ ਜੈਸੇ ਬੁਦਬੁਦਾ ਕੌ ਪ੍ਰਗਾਸ ਤਾਸ ਨਾਮ ਪਲਕ ਮੈ ਨ ਤੳੁ ਠਹਿਰਾਤ ਹੈ
transliteration: Barakhaa Samai Jaisay Budabudaa Kau Pragaasa , Taas Naam Palak Mai N Tau Tthahiraat Hai ?
translation: Just as bubbles appear on water when rain-drops on it, and very soon these bubbles explode and disappear from the surface;

gurmukhi: ਗ੍ਰੀਖਮ ਸਮੈ ਜੈਸੇ ਤੳੁ ਮ੍ਰਿਗ ਤ੍ਰਿਸਨਾ ਚਰਿਤ੍ਰ ਝਾੲੀ ਸੀ ਦਿਖਾੲੀ ਦੇਤ ੳੁਪਜਿ ਸਮਾਤ ਹੈ
transliteration: Greekham Samai Jaisay Tau Mrig Trisanaa Charitra , Jhaaee See Dikhaaee Dayt Oupaji Samaat Hai ?
translation: Just as a thirsty deer is disillusioned of the presence of water, the hot shimmering sand (mirage) that disappears in time then he reaches that spot;

gurmukhi: ਤੈਸੇ ਮੋਹ ਮਾੲਿਅਾ ਛਾੲਿਅਾ ਬਿਰਖ ਚਪਲ ਛਲ ਛਲੈ ਛੈਲ ਸ੍ਰੀ ਗੁਰ ਚਰਨ ਲਪਟਾਤ ਹੈ ॥੩੧੧॥
transliteration: Taisay Moh Maaiaa Chhaaiaa Birakh Chapal Chhala , Chhalai Chhail Sree Gur Charan Lapataat Hai ?311?
translation: So is the love of Maya that keeps changing its master like the shadow of a tree. But the Naam practitioner devotee of the Guru who remains engrossed in the holy feet of the True, he is able to control the attractive and trickster maya with ease. (311)
